passage_text: Tuition and Fees. Tuition at the University of Arizona for out-of-state students is about $31,600 per year ($15,800 per semester). Additional, mandatory university fees equal to around $1,000 per year. More information about mandatory fees and what they entail can be obtained here. *Guaranteed Tuition Policy.

The total list price for in-state New Mexico residents to go to NMSU is $15,256 for the 2014/2015 academic year. Out-of-state students who don't possess New Mexico residence can expect a one year cost of $28,418.

The cost is $437 and 20% cheaper than the average New Mexico tuition of $2,213 for 2 year colleges. Tuition ranks 16th in New Mexico amongst 2 year colleges for affordability and is the 4th most expensive 2 year college in the state. If attending from out-of-state, the tuition is $4,992 which represents a 181% premium.

The cost is $6,995 and 59% cheaper than the average New Mexico tuition of $11,807 for 4 year colleges. Tuition ranks 7th in New Mexico amongst 4 year colleges for affordability and is the 12th most expensive 4 year college in the state.

For new students, there is an one-time, non-recurring enrollment fee of $50. The base-cost of each class is $75. However, when more classes are purchased, lower class prices are automatic. Class can be purchased by an individual or through a group account, where several student have access to a pool of class coupons.
